metadata.synopsis: Right before Karlach's recruitment Wyl recognizes her as the target Mizora gave to him. It will be up to the player to avoid the confrontation with her. https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Xh6W54Z2kT7NfVgxgmED_3BD2sbbs62vjFxXMYfMGgc/edit?pli=1#bookmark=id.y05ljfyxmujl
metadata.how_to_trigger: With Wyll as an avatar or as a companion but alone and far from the party speak with Karlach during her recruimtent.

49.speaker: Karlach
49.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning.
NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

143.speaker: Wyll
143.text: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.

1.speaker: Karlach
1.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
1.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach looks to Wyll, smiles, and stands, shaking the flames off herself.
"Well I'll be..."

308.speaker: Wyll
308.text: I know who you are and I know who you serve. Zariel's lickspittle, gladiator in the archdevil's army.

223.speaker: Karlach
223.text: You've got to be half-troll for your head to be that hard. I'm not working for Zariel. I'm running from her.

292.speaker: Karlach
292.text: We've both got a brain-worm. I know you can see into my mind, see the truth. I'm home now - out of the Hells. I just want to live.

169.speaker: Wyll
169.text: I won't fall for this devilish trickery.
169.context: NodeContext: Fighting with himself. He doesn't want to believe it.

115.speaker: Karlach
115.text: Please. It's Wyll, right? We don't have to do this.
115.context: NodeContext: Trying one last effort to calm him.

73.speaker: Wyll
73.text: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.
73.context: NodeContext: Fighting with himself. He doesn't want to believe it. Not killing Karlach means punishment from Mizora

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *If you take her at her word, you can't possibly fulfil your mission in good conscience. But break the terms of your pact, and the consequences will be unfathomable.*

91.speaker: Wyll
91.text: If I believe you, Karlach, it'll be me who pays the price.

222.speaker: Wyll
222.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) There's a pause, and then Wyll swears. He realises he has resigned himself to becoming a devil himself. He's upset - but he knows he did the right thing.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: You really are no devil, are you? I've... I've been deceived.

71.speaker: Karlach
71.text: Thank the gods. Thought I was going to have to take your head.
71.context: NodeContext: Relieved Wyll is seeing sense. Calming down from her anger.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: You would've died in the attempt. But - there have been enough threats today.

248.speaker: Karlach
248.context: NodeContext: A little bit of uncertainty, hoping Wyll is calming down

217.speaker: Wyll
217.context: NodeContext: Resigned to his fate but knows he's making the right decision in not attacking Karlach.

293.speaker: Karlach
293.text: Look - you don't have to trust me blindly. I'll prove to you I'm as clean as they come. In fact, we're in the same line of work, in a way.

305.speaker: Karlach
305.text: I'd like to team up. Send your leader my way so we can work out the particulars.

63.speaker: Karlach
63.text: I think I told you to get the fuck out of my face, for your own good.

137.speaker: Karlach
137.text: I think I told you to get the fuck out of my face, for your own good.

266.speaker: Karlach
266.context:
CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach is crouched, head in hands, breathing heavily, surrounded by flames, burning.
NodeContext: A sound that could be mistaken for a fire building within her, or consuming her from within

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Karlach looks up to player (Wyll) standing there, and stands up, body still aflame.

99.speaker: Lae'zel
99.text: Chk. This is Zariel's servant wreaking havoc on the Coast?

267.speaker: Karlach
267.text: Look - it's an honour to be chased by a famed hero. I'm no devil, though. Not by a long shot.

179.speaker: Wyll
179.text: You were engulfed in flames but a moment ago. Only a devil could have survived it.

273.speaker: Karlach
273.text: I can explain. But it's a whole situation.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: My sources say otherwise. Not a devil? Prove it.

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: How should I do that exactly? Carve out my soul to serve with a nice side of turnips?

171.speaker: Karlach
171.text: If you'd just hear me out -

211.speaker: Narrator
211.text: *The parasites connect you, a vision unfolds. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *Her rage and desperation seep into you. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands to temples, mindmeld is happening

245.speaker: Karlach
245.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overcome by the mind meld. It's the first time it's happened. She shakes off her shock and looks at Wyll.

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: I'll give you one chance to explain what I just saw.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: I never wanted to serve Zariel. I was enlisted in her army against my will. Forced to fight, and fight I did.

297.speaker: Karlach
297.text: When I saw an opportunity to get away, I took it. I'm finally home - or near it, anyway.

254.speaker: Wyll
254.text: You almost seem to mean it.

198.speaker: Karlach
198.text: And you almost seem sensible. On my heart, I'm telling you the truth.
198.context: NodeContext: Her version of 'on my honour.' Sincerely, trying to convince Wyll she's not a devil

277.speaker: Wyll
277.text: How do I know this isn't another devil's trick?

84.speaker: Karlach
84.text: You know monsters, right? Better than anyone. Look into my eyes. Can't you see I'm not what you think?

208.speaker: Narrator
208.text: *If you believe her, killing her would be a crime. But break your pact, and the consequences will be unfathomable.*

186.speaker: Wyll
186.text: You don't understand what you're asking me to do.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: I want us both to live. That's all.

131.speaker: Karlach
131.text: Whatever the consequences may be, we'll face them together. If you'll have me.

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: Save your breath. Let's see if this devil bleeds.

309.speaker: Karlach
309.text: Please. It's Wyll, right? We don't have to do this.
309.context: NodeContext: Trying one last effort to calm him.

161.speaker: Lae'zel
161.text: Control yourself, Wyll. I understand bloodthirst. But this is no time to quench it.

173.speaker: Shadowheart
173.text: Stand down, Wyll. She's fiery, but no devil.

53.speaker: Astarion
53.text: Now, now, children - let's not lose our heads. Figuratively or literally.
53.context: NodeContext: Wyll and Karlach are ready to fight and kill each other. Astarion speaks up to try and stop them

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *If you believe her, killing her would be a crime. But break your pact, and the consequences will be unfathomable.*

158.speaker: Wyll
158.text: If I believe you, Karlach, it'll be me who pays the price.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Whatever that price may be, I'll help you pay it. We'll be in this together.

233.speaker: Wyll
233.text: How can I make peace with the monster I was sent to kill?

241.speaker: Wyll
241.text: You don't know what this means. You don't know what you're asking me to do.

129.speaker: Karlach
129.text: I'm asking you to live, Wyll. I don't want to hurt you. And, to be frank, I'd rather not find out how the Blade got his name.

315.speaker: Wyll
315.text: Dammit. This is an unwelcome complication.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Thank the gods, he sees sense! Look, Blade - Wyll - I know you love bashing evil - we have that in common.

202.speaker: Karlach
202.text: What say we take our mind off things with a little fun?

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: I may not be a devil, but I can put that reputation of yours to work.

296.speaker: Karlach
296.text: How would you feel about helping me kill some evil bastards?
296.context: CinematicNodeContext: (SCENE) Wyll stands down and Karlach douses her flames.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: That sounds like exactly what I need.

50.speaker: Karlach
50.text: A little background, if your moral compass needs something to point at...
50.context: NodeContext: About to tell a story

312.speaker: Karlach
312.text: You already know I fought in the Blood War. I was good. Really good.
312.context: CinematicNodeContext: Vision that shows Karlach in action. Karlach speaks over the shots. (We’ll reuse this for her origin intro then)

100.speaker: Karlach
100.text: Turns out I've got a knack for killing demons. That made me a valuable asset. Zariel - the archdevil herself - made me as her personal attack dog.

175.speaker: Karlach
175.text: I played along until I could get the fuck out of there, but devils don't like to lose their assets.

87.speaker: Karlach
87.text: Zariel liked it so little, she sent a bunch of goons, so-called 'Paladins of Tyr' after me. Until a minute ago, I thought you were working with them. They want to take me back to the Hells.

247.speaker: Karlach
247.text: But believe me when I say I'd rather die.

250.speaker: Wyll
250.text: Let's send them back where they came from.

102.speaker: Karlach
102.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

257.speaker: Karlach
257.text: Then we can work on evicting this parasite and take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

199.speaker: Lae'zel
199.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

184.speaker: Shadowheart
184.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

85.speaker: Karlach
85.text: I'd hug you if it wouldn't scorch your skin off.

318.speaker: Wyll
318.text: Hang on - I said I'd help you, not team up with you long-term.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: Trust me - when you see what I'm capable of, you won't regret it.

192.speaker: Astarion
192.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
192.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

225.speaker: Gale
225.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
225.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

178.speaker: Wyll
178.text: So you want me to kill the people hunting you?

98.speaker: Karlach
98.text: Don't worry, I'll lead the charge. But I could use your help. There's a lot of them and only one of me. After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

272.speaker: Lae'zel
272.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

219.speaker: Shadowheart
219.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

168.speaker: Astarion
168.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
168.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

196.speaker: Wyll
196.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

200.speaker: Karlach
200.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. Gets even messier the more bodies you throw at it. Think of the potential.
200.context: NodeContext: Some light flirtation in her voice.

213.speaker: Gale
213.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
213.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

155.speaker: Wyll
155.text: Why should I do your dirty work?

121.speaker: Karlach
121.text: Dirty work's the only kind I like. But there are a lot of them and just the one of me. I'll take point, and you flank 'em.

263.speaker: Karlach
263.text: After that, we can team up. Take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

86.speaker: Lae'zel
86.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

269.speaker: Shadowheart
269.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

224.speaker: Astarion
224.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
224.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

58.speaker: Gale
58.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
58.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

15.speaker: Karlach
15.text: Fuck yes. They cornered me outside the tollhouse, just up the hill. Doubt they've gone far after the scorching I gave 'em.

187.speaker: Wyll
187.text: I have good news for you. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

164.speaker: Wyll
164.text: I have good news for you. I already took care of the paladins you say were hunting you.

109.speaker: Karlach
109.text: That's incredible! In that case, you ought to let me return the favour. My muscle for your aid in my battle against the powers of the arch-bitch.

286.speaker: Karlach
286.context: NodeContext: with hand to side of mouth like a battle/ sports shout.

110.speaker: Karlach
110.text: Why don't you clear things with your leader before we team up. Send 'em my way so we can work out the particulars.

207.speaker: Karlach
207.text: If there's one thing Zariel taught me, it's not to fuck with the top dog until it's absolutely necessary.

264.speaker: Karlach
264.text: No room in your party. What should I do?

47.speaker: Karlach
47.text: All right - I'll catch up with you later. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

51.speaker: Karlach
51.text: I'll catch up with you when it's time to camp, for now. But don't get to any of the fun stuff without me - got it?

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.

183.speaker: Narrator
183.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

150.speaker: Astarion
150.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
150.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

180.speaker: Wyll
180.text: Gale could do with a rest.

288.speaker: Gale
288.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

227.speaker: Jaheira
227.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
227.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

300.speaker: Shadowheart
300.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

18.speaker: Halsin
18.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

231.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
231.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

325.speaker: Karlach
325.text: Hang on, though - looks like you've got enough backup at your side. Not sure there's room for me.

5.speaker: Karlach
5.text: Phew, I'm getting all het up. Let's make tracks!

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: I don't think so - you'll have to go it alone.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: Damn. After a decade in hell, I was hoping for a little company. Even a big hero once out for my head.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: But I can take a hint. Good luck out there. You're gonna need it.

326.speaker: Wyll
326.text: I have good news for you, then. I already killed the paladins you say were hunting you.

320.speaker: Karlach
320.text: You did?! That's incredible! You ought to let me return the favour. We can team up - evict this parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

203.speaker: Lae'zel
203.text: A warrior who winks at her foes while she slays them. You'd be a fool to refuse her.

281.speaker: Shadowheart
281.text: I like her. She looks like she could throw me over her shoulder and carry me to safety, should the need arise.

78.speaker: Astarion
78.text: She's almost as scary as you, Lae'zel. So naturally she gets my vote.
78.context: NodeContext: "You want to just..." has a "wtf are you thinking?" tone. Then "Because I'm fine with that." is very calm and matter-of-fact

255.speaker: Wyll
255.text: All right - welcome to the team.

301.speaker: Gale
301.text: She's, erm, perhaps a little rough around the edges... but I suppose I can be smooth enough for two...
301.context: NodeContext: A little skeptical (taking on a new, larger than life companion)

116.speaker: Wyll
116.text: I have my own problems. I don't need yours.

279.speaker: Karlach
279.text: I can see that. But look, if we take care of my little problem, we can move on to yours next. and the tadpole after that.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Kill some fiends, evict a parasite, then take Faerûn by the short hairs. Sound good?

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: I've got more important things on my mind than monster-hunting at the moment.

276.speaker: Karlach
276.text: I understand, but hear me out. These fucks will be especially fun to hunt.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: That remains to be seen. I'm sure I'll find out by nightfall.

283.speaker: Karlach
283.text: I won't pester you for details now, but believe me Wyll, I'll be there by your side, whatever comes.

212.speaker: Wyll
212.text: I've broken a vow I swore never to break. My punishment will be severe.

42.speaker: Karlach
42.text: That sounds serious. But look, Wyll, you won't face it alone. Whatever it is. I owe you that much.

149.speaker: Karlach
149.text: Maybe I could even show you a little fun before the hammer falls.

240.speaker: Wyll
240.text: It will mean my undoing, but... I believe you.

304.speaker: Karlach
304.text: Thank the gods. I would've taken no pleasure in burning you to a crisp. Well, not much anyway.

136.speaker: Karlach
136.text: And look - you don't have to trust me blindly. I'll prove to you I'm as clean as they come. In fact, we're in the same line of work, in a way.

170.speaker: Wyll
170.text: No. No second-guessing. The devil dies - now.

79.speaker: Karlach
79.text: Too bad. I thought maybe you could be a friend. I could've done with one of those.

190.speaker: Gale
190.text: Stand down, Wyll. She may add a little extra spice to her language, but she's no devil.

274.speaker: Wyll
274.text: I'm sorry, Karlach. There's too much at stake.

74.speaker: Wyll
74.text: No - I can't believe it. I've been sent to kill you. I can't let you go.

154.speaker: Wyll
154.text: The tadpole that links us suggests you're no willing servant of Zariel.

142.speaker: Karlach
142.text: The tadpole. Gods, there's more to this thing than I realised.

64.speaker: Karlach
64.text: Well, whatever else it may be, the tadpole isn't a liar. I never wanted to serve Zariel, and I escaped the first chance I could.

278.speaker: Wyll
278.text: No... I won't fall for this devilish trickery...

311.speaker: Wyll
311.text: You fight in the Blood War for Zariel. You'll bring violence to the Coast.

191.speaker: Karlach
191.text: Yeah, I stowed away on a mind flayer ship so I could bring the war home. Makes perfect sense.

188.speaker: Wyll
188.text: I've hunted you to the Hells and beyond. It ends here, Karlach.

226.speaker: Karlach
226.text: For shit's sake, you must be half troll to possess a skull that thick.

209.speaker: Shadowheart
209.text: This is your target, Wyll? I think you may have been misinformed...

232.speaker: Astarion
232.text: This is your target? I was expecting a little more from a devil.
232.context: NodeContext: Astarion was expecting the target to be a flaming infernal devil, but is actually just a wounded tiefling. He's a little underwhelmed.

228.speaker: Gale
228.text: This is your quarry, Wyll? Less devilish than I had anticipated.

234.speaker: Wyll
234.text: Karlach. Advocatus diaboli. I won't be lectured on monsters by Zariel's servant.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: If I'm wrong about you, prove it. Lay down your weapon, and I will too.

324.speaker: Karlach
324.text: Well, well, well. How the Blade of Frontiers has changed.

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: I thought you hunted devils, Wyll. Not innocents. Were all those people in the druid's grove monsters? Or is the only monster you?

172.speaker: Wyll
172.text: Karlach. Advocatus diaboli. I won't be lectured on monsters by Zariel's servant.

282.speaker: Karlach
282.text: Were all those people Zariel's servants too? Or is it possible you're going after the wrong people.

39.speaker: Karlach
39.text: I guess it doesn't matter now. Your trail of blood ends here and now.

284.speaker: Wyll
284.text: I don't know who told you I was involved in the grove, but it wasn't me.

45.speaker: Karlach
45.text: That's a load of shit. But you know what? Vengeance can wait. And I have other priorities today.

43.speaker: Karlach
43.text: Tsk. That was pathetic - it really was. How said that shitty lie will be the last thing you say. Bye, Blade.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: If I'm wrong about you, prove it. Lay down your weapon, and I will too.

4.speaker: Karlach
4.text: You'd like that, wouldn't you? Set down my blade and watch as you plunge yours in my heart. Not a chance. I intend to live - over your dead body.

147.speaker: Wyll
147.text: If you value your life, you'll stand down.

159.speaker: Karlach
159.text: Argh! You back away first, all right? One false move, and you're dead. I've more important things to do today than kill a rat.

41.speaker: Karlach
41.text: Get the fuck out of here. Now. Before I change my mind.

258.speaker: Karlach
258.text: Oh, I want to live. Just not in a world with you in it.
258.context: NodeContext: This precedes combat so heightened.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: You've got it all wrong. I've got a contract for your head, and I'm going to take it.

112.speaker: Karlach
112.context: NodeContext: Player just said they're here for her head. She's going to fight them after this.

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: I don't need to explain myself to Zariel's lickspittle. Your head is mine.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: I didn't want those people to die. It was all a big mistake.

111.speaker: Karlach
111.text: Tell it to their corpses. Murderer.

166.speaker: Wyll
166.text: I'm not the only one after you, Karlach. Some paladins of Tyr want you dead, too. I suppose we're all wrong about you?

261.speaker: Karlach
261.text: You suppose right. Not that it matters anymore. You're too dangerous - I've got to put a stop to you.

130.speaker: Wyll
130.text: I won't explain myself to a devil. Face me!

153.speaker: Karlach
153.context: NodeContext: Burning hot, right before a fight.
